document.title: Hawai ªi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

9EF0F17F664742819668ADAF750EEBE9.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

5BAF4B19927D423BB5E404BF47DF6128.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

FC6061CD42304BF8ADB3BF2AA55C971C.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

2FA9C054396D4540898486366FBDD635.description: Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

908F032CBE414E259E68BF2FD204B675.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings:

1A98342952FA4A36B56BF0C7933DF804.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

89D691230B9646C6A9C71A8E0FB87B5F.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

37AA0A5823F845DF97E438986158DCDB.description: Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

4102053108AE4C9080F0CC4406644DDB.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies:

FCB5101FCCE04A8AA076D4E9692F71D7.description: Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

7445945E544E4FEB96DFA20C1ACDE92B.description: Use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

CF97058DFAAE400B870D24331881B405.description: Use and explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.

4BA7BC614FD341CDBDB43E94AED73C90.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

A4CC7579738F48EBAEF88235C326F30F.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

ADD40300E29F4FE5A9F09066BC0CCB69.description: Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

0A0477A8C3A94D7C95776A4D5EA219A5.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

C0DE80A008CC4CE79F7A29770CE8F436.description: Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D4C543E1C78A4E559414B8A1A35A7DF6.description: Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

517429D313B2467BA3C168CCA3AC65EC.description: Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.

83F3753AB6904F8385A36F72B940C376.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

D9AFE169AA534D95AB4450636CFDB762.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

9D936102353442A8862B1EFD24D25163.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others‚Äô ideas and expressing their own clearly:

98E8EBCE881841EC83670799249AA6AB.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

E3AE84EAF87343B5BA8C9A7EE33533E5.description: Summarize or paraphrase in notes and finished work the relevant information collected from experiences and/or print and digital sources, and provide a list of sources.

3F86026DCC014194905555080A0A01CA.description: Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic:

3FDD8B7D074B458FB0DBD41409F8443F.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

A7B6A4560CD8452DA4FE39A02B25C543.description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

A6E6F255FB13446CA62A4D94A05037EC.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Writing Foundations and Language standards.)

876B8F08E89C4653945B5BDF3E9DC806.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

67AB15F667FD476AB1DD59732080102C.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

412BC5762C314220B47F324D7E0A13B8.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

05D887AAAB814B73A108E63F12336FBA.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

B7C33370D1A3402FB51150D96A78B2A7.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

E28AF8289DFD4096AD639255AB09140D.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences:

ECBD267E36D64B65891B6D700D645FA3.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

BE9BEE3573924AE98A30C9C9B222F38C.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

AFBB408D95974AAB8C936936118B648D.description: Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

9922BA364A9F4586942C65EE61C453EC.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

5A19AC11544E47D7A53E43F480ABA9EB.description: Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and organize related information logically; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aid comprehension.

DBCFA36207CB4DD88233705EF99A5887.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly:

8C571E562CA243BFA48219BF266D2DD8.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the argument presented, as appropriate to the task.

AFAF6364C91A400E9C555D8F43A6078D.description: Link the claim and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).

EF93EFA32C45419BAE0FB3F541D873F1.description: Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.

D1244A2E70CF48DEA96E5790615806D4.description: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state a claim, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer‚Äôs purpose.

824B4D0875A843CF9B31085925279C82.description: Write argumentative/opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a claim with reasons and information:

359361DB6C0B4F2DBF9321F4F4DC0BCE.description: Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

841E5467CA694F71A48904A81744AEE2.description: Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It‚Äôs true, isn‚Äôt it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

61BBFD8168714A36ACCF2D43A62E9AFE.description: Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.

44053D2EF01E4CD1B0E73E23B8B9409B.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

A33AC325A39C4E0CA8CEAC6B6005AA26.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English when writing, including multi-paragraph texts:

2B0D33B604EE45509FB338E98D6DF228.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

2EB32CE0DCB945528CD7C4E4DF317F59.description: Use knowledge of Greek and Latin roots to accurately spell multisyllabic words.

0515FDE1AB29487D9B24E4C6FB9E75A5.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words:

5C21CF317FB240DDA64952908A6C6EA8.description: Legibly and fluently write in manuscript to produce grade-appropriate tasks.

4D252B21FAEA40CB889C5EC3D0D11407.description: Demonstrate and apply correct handwriting skills:

404635D621A04468B35D4B18D076DB7E.description: Read and comprehend literary texts appropriately complex for grade 5.

9C28F6FD9990406AA66FF94F28281D33.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

0BA30529AD604C8A80A9201A03E81846.description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

F38939B43E8A4527A5B50D064C7E7022.description: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

6FCC45EEB23345B599E748985D1863C2.description: Describe how a narrator‚Äôs or speaker‚Äôs perspective influences how events are described, including the impact of the point of view.

417F1DEC157E480CA6DCCF923A615282.description: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

E8BE034B166E474990E087FBF83641F9.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

69631B50D765416C9ECE4965A7EC7E38.description: Drawing on specific details in the text, compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama.

8BC369C76D2A48C7A9F1CA38E61C5E8D.description: Summarize the text, incorporating a theme determined from details in the text.

3D80B6453DC343FCAE02824E22838ADD.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic.

14F454F5619B490B982D3C8627109CFB.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

C0C0CBD3476342BEB1BD5BED67C9CDAE.description: Read and comprehend informational texts appropriately complex for grade 5.

28F43F768437490CB981A57788A460E5.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

528E4815416044B9BC9DFFB5AB0B8427.description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

3C94C58BAEDC4ABAAC539A9C0902E0A6.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

B861D9F49EB54CC6B9A254A9066FA476.description: Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

6C50C35C97144A6C857B01E73C4B9ED5.description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view/perspective they represent.

652C1680EC104AC3BABD5066061EF0C1.description: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

8050E2FCF1394DF49714E82D2F11835C.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

DF72CC5C52AF4B0E97B6FBBB46918142.description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

871C2688637F48F4BE1C8249FED9347F.description: Summarize the text, incorporating how the key details support the main/central ideas.

5755CD508F3340728E6600A398139A8A.description: Determine two or more main/central ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by the key details.

D51283620CFB4E36B3293A6F2D042BB9.description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

8B1EB6170BA0464FB6DCE1B563A1F175.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.

5D27B22FFA3342AD8A5E613308B50798.description: Read complex and decodable and irregular high frequency words.

AC7723CE3DE94043BB024D217A04EB4B.description: Apply knowledge of syllables, word origins, and morphemes when reading and determining word meaning.

2BC983A0779949FC87708D32A507244C.description: Greek and Latin Roots and Affixes

DD77B2D1C0EB4F4997F0236C8EE1BEAA.description: Read multisyllabic words in isolation and in text, including:

546CBD209C75439F86A5DBD17AFA6B15.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to read:
